data.title: Talents – Definitive Talents, Inc.
data.text:
An all-star cast of musicians that played with artists such as Aerosmith, Toni Braxton, Beyoncé, Rock of Ages, Australian Bee Gees, Tenors of Rock, Zowie Bowie and many more. Hot Sauce is led by a female violinist/vocalist and a male percussionist/latin vocalist. They can play anything from country, Top 40, hip-hop, old school R&B, to latin music.

The Sin City Devils will deliver—and get the house singing and dancing along to hit music from the nostalgic 80’s, to hair-banging rock anthems, and on up to the most current Top-40 dance tunes! Play along with the band’s interactive performance style, and they’ll even coax out the inner “rockstars” of your guests!

Think Kenny Loggins meets Kool & The Gang with some sprinkle of Earth, Wind, & Fire. Members of this band were signed to record labels with major success in commercial radio as artists or producers in the past.

The Majority is a cross-cultural, genre meshing contemporary Reggae band. Raised on 90’s R&B, Hip Hop and Pop, massively inspired by Country and Soul, The Majority fuses its Reggae foundation with all of their diverse influences. With it’s members roots strongly planted in the Hawaiian Islands, The Majority now makes Las Vegas (the 9th Island) it’s home, serving as the launching pad for thrilling live performances and intoxicating new music. We are The Majority!

Capturing you with music from every era and every genre, the group will take you on a non-stop journey through time. Music from Luther Vandross, Al Green, ToTo, The Temptations, The Whispers, Kool & The Gang, Journey, Smokey Robinson, The Four Tops, Earth, Wind & Fire, Santana, Outkast, and Frank Sinatra as well as Robin Thicke., Justin Timberlake, The Black Eyed Peas, Charlie Wilson, Usher, Kem and Pharell.

‘State of Mind is a group of “first call” musicians who have performed around the world. State of Mind can stylistically perform all styles of music, adding their little spin on the arrangements. Pop, Rock, RnB, Latin, Country... No genre of music is off-limits for this group of outstanding musicians.’ Vegas.

The quintet XCSO Band was formed in Las Vegas in 2017. It is a multilingual band that has a wide variety of styles such as REGGAETON, ROC EN' ESPANOL (Latin Rock), ENGLISH LATIN RADIO POP, SALSA, CUMBIA, BACHATA, MERENGUE, AND SKA.

East Side Riot bases their material in the 80’s, but they also drop contemporary favorites and unexpected, forgotten “gems” throughout the show.

They’ll also do special request and custom structure their sets if occasion calls for it.

The Swing It! Girls are a vintage vocal trio featuring music of the 1930’s-1960’s. Their shows transport audiences back to the days of dance halls and big bands, as they bring back the swing with timeless boogie-woogie hits.

RumRunners are four wise guys who have collected an aggregate of 100 years of musical experience to deliver the best of blues, R&B and rock classics as well as jazz, swing, surf, country, motown, and rockabilly.

The Doo-Wop Kings are one of Las Vegas’s finest acapella vocal groups serving up a perfect blend of the 50's & 60's classics. They sing current pop hits with a doo-wop twist leaving the younger generation standing in awe, and the older generation smiling in reminiscence.

A five-piece high energy top 40 band that covers tunes from the 70’s to the present. Their versatile talent allow them to perform an electrifying variety of the latest dance, disco, funk, latin, rock, and R & B.

HNLV Band plays all genres of music from the 60’s, 70’s, 80’s and current hits. From R&B, Dance, Rock and Latin sound. Full of life and versatility. No doubt a talented group of musicians, each one not only exceptional in at least two instruments but strong vocals as well.

With six musicians that also sings, this magical ensemble covers music of all genres. R&B, Hip Hop, Latin, Old School, Disco, OPM, right up to today’s latest hits. The KLIQUE SHOWBAND mesmerizes audiences encouraging dancing and participation with a fearless sense of humor.

A premier Country and Rock Band based out of Las Vegas, Nevada and currently performs throughout the Southwest. Their music consist of super groups such as Led Zeppelin, Journey, AC/DC, Johnny Cash, ZZ Top, The Eagles, and solo artist such as Stevie Ray Vaughan, Carrie Underwood, Miranda Lambert, Toby Keith and much more.

LUVALLURE ignites the evening with sounds from the heavy-hits era. Jenn and the Boys are an entertainment machine flaunting their musicianship backed with stage energy, looks, and tons of style.

The Rob Staley Band is a country band that digs deep into the heart and soul of country music. They provide a unique look on how traditional country music can be played in a modern setting.

FUGA (meaning "FIRE") touches many different genres of regional Mexican styles of songs such as rancheras, corridos, cumbias, boleros, ballads, among others. FUGA has a song selection that will keep ANY Dancefloor into life and have their audience at their feet... ALL NIGHT LONG

Captivating to listen to, she can easily seduce a crowd with her velvety voice and her classic touch on the piano, or rock the house accompanied by some of the highest calibre musicians in South Florida. Melina is often compared to international artists like Norah Jones, Diana Krall, Alicia Keys and Sade.

Funk music artist Cliff Beach has been performing live for more than 17 years in Los Angeles. The Berklee-trained singer/songwriter/keyboardist and DC native has created a style of music he coins as “Nu-funk”, a hybrid of soul, traditional R&B, funk and neo-soul which he performs throughout the U.S.A.

Singer/recording artist Laura Shaffer started performing professionally at age 18. She studied 3 different instruments and dance in her youth, but singing was the way for her to convey her love for music to her audience. Spending years honing her talents working on the world-famous Las Vegas Strip and being mentored by show business industry veterans, Laura continues to perform in all of its major hotels.

Voted Best of Las Vegas, Art Vargas has been entertaining Vegas audiences for over 35 years. Art represents the style, music and classic showmanship of the legendary entertainers of Vegas’ Golden Era, from the finger snappin’ cool of Bobby Darin to the swinging exuberance of Louis Prima.

With only his 6-string bass guitar, looping pedals, and various effects, Jozef records comprehensive and layered backing tracks, over which he plays the melody, harmony parts, and complicated solos live in performance at your event. All the backing chords, harmonies and sub-melodies are produced by Jozef.

Rita Lim and David Siegel have an illustrious set of accomplishments in a variety of aspects individually, however when they teamed up in 2016 in Las Vegas, together they not only produced the acclaimed Sade and Carpenters tribute shows, but also hold down their Sunday night spot at the Tuscanny as well as stints at the prestigious Le Chat Noir Jazz Club in Miami Florida

With her rich, silky, unique voice, Sina has been touted as the “Best Piano-Bar Crooner” in Las Vegas by “SEVEN Magazine”. She is equally at home belting out Rock tunes and getting urban cool with Pop/R&B favorites. Her iconic look, signature sound, and captivating stage presence have made many instant fans in the Entertainment Capital of the World.

Rosanna performs 2 tribute shows herself - as “Patsy Cline” and “Connie Francis”. She has performed these shows in notable venues in Las Vegas, Palm Springs and Arizona. Her performances includes songs in Latin, Portuguese, French and various styles such as Oldies, Blues, Country and Pop, as well as current music.

A versatile keyboardist, Grant takes you on a musical journey through the greatest hits of Frank Sinatra, Elton John, James Taylor, Neil Diamond, Beatles, Bee Gees, Michael Jackson, Sade and Nora Jones, including classic rock hits by the Eagles, Santana, the Doobie Brothers, Sting and contemporary artists like Dr. Dre, Justin Bieber, Nick Jonas, Ellie Goulding and Maroon 5. Grant delivers a high-energy, killer performances on the “keytar”.

Micah Smith's piano-playing and compositions are characterized by a remarkable melodic sensibility, harmonic sophistication, and ability to blend seamlessly into any musical context. Micah has performed at The Mayfair Supper Club at the Bellagio, Delilah Supper Club at the Wynn, and The Gambit in Henderson.

Dennis is a multi-awarded musical arranger, songwriter, film scorer, pianist and record producer for artists like Lani Misalucha and Ogie Alcasid, and teleserye theme songs like Esperanza and Anna Karenina . He directed musical events of John Lesaca, Tadao Hayashi, Rachel Alejandro and others. He is an Awit Awards Finalist for Best Musical Arranger in 1999 and 2002.

David Siegel’s name is on over 40 millions records sold, with artists such as Celine Dion, Beyoncé, Jessica Simpson, Enrique Iglesias, Flo Rida, T.I., Pusha T, Soulja Boy, Ricky Martin, Marc Anthony, Amerie, CNCO, Clay Aiken, Elliot Yamin, Thalia, and several “NOW That’s What I Call Music” compilations.

BRAND G is the alter-ego of Brandon Garcia, one of the most talented guitar players in Las Vegas that plays multiple music genres such as Classic to Contemporary Pop, Rock, Latin, and Jazz.

A singer and pianist who performs your favorite songs from every era - from Frank Sinatra to Ed Sheeran, and EVERYTHING in between. Currently performing at prominent venues in Las Vegas including the Marriott’s Grand Chateau, the Cromwell and Aria Resort and Casino.

The Bronx Wanderers have been going strong for over 16 years and have amassed many accolades such as touring the entire country headlining festivals, PACs, and casinos.

A master of the classical and electric guitars, as well as the distinctive Puerto Rican cuatro, “El Gato” blazes in a number of musical styles including Classical, Latin and Flamenco. Ricardo Ricardo played with Linda Ronstadt, Tower of Power, Esteban, Los Lobos, Malo, Charlie Zaa and Elvis Crespo in the past.

A veteran solo performer who traveled the world with his impeccable presentation that stunned all sorts of audiences by having a repertoire of classic and current Top 40 Radio Hits, Classic Rock, Dance, Instrumental, R&B, Blues, Soul Music, and even sang in different languages.

Since her first gig at the Palazzo Vanessa has performed all over the Las Vegas Strip singing all genres from pop to jazz, to country and rock. She has performed on Freemont Street, Toby Keith’s, The M Resort, Bootlegger, among many others in and out of Las Vegas.

Lead vocalist and multi instrumentalists (Guitar, Fiddle, Mandolin, Harmonica, and Piano). With 3 solo Country albums and a headliner at Gilley’s in Branson, MO. Performing with Bob Birch (Elton John band) Chad Watson (MD for Charlie Rich) Paul Warren (MoTown guitarist) Delaney Bramlett (Producer, Song writer) Dwight Yoakam, and Buck Owens to name a few.

A 6 piece ensemble that plays traditional jazz in the style that originated in New Orleans and Chicago during the 1920’s. They play the music of the Speakeasies of Chicago to the streets of New Orleans.

Ultimate Santana Tribute Experience, Evil Waze, features Mike Torres on guitar. Torres, who lives in Phoenix, Arizona, not only sounds strikingly similar to Santana but is a mirror image of the guitar legend as well. Mike has played with such big stars as Michael McDonald, Al DiMeola and Spyro Gyra. Santana tribute bandmatches the realism of Evil Waze.

Queen of the Night! Remembering Whitney, starring Trina Johnson Finn is a 90 minute live entertainment show that brings the top selling hits of the late Whitney Houston to the stage. This show will showcase fan-favorite songs from Whitney Houston’s past albums along with snappy dialogue providing personal insight behind each song.

Tommy Ward is a critically acclaimed singer and entertainer from Las Vegas who has a deep love and appreciation for legendary musicians and crooners. At only 25 years old, he has already made a name for himself in the entertainment industry, and his videos on social media have racked up millions of views.

Delaware native and Peabody graduate Todd Simon thrived in the Baltimore/D.C. jazz scene as a keyboardist and saxophonist. He remains an active multi-instrumentalist, vocalist, composer, and arranger covering many genres.
